{{Infobox Radio station | name = WPUP | image = | city = [[Watkinsville, Georgia]] | area = Athens Metro | slogan = "Athens New #1 Hit Music Station" | branding = ''Power 100.1'' | frequency = 100.1 [[MHz]] | repeater = | airdate = | format = [[Top 40]] | erp = 4,300 [[watt]]s | haat = 88 meters | class = A | facility_id = 51120 | coordinates = {{Coord|33|44|2.00|N| 82|43|10.00|W|region:US_type:landmark|display=inline,title}} | callsign_meaning = | former_callsigns = WLOV-FM (1978â1984)
WGPL (1984â1998)
WXKT (1998â2008)| owner = [[Cox Radio]] | licensee = | sister_stations = [[WNGC]], [[WGAU]], [[WXKT]], [[WGMG]], [[WRFC (AM)|WRFC]] | webcast = [http://streaming.powerathens.com/_players/coxradio/index.php?callsign=WPUPFM Listen Live] | website = [http://powerathens.com powerathens.com] | affiliations = }} '''WPUP''' (100.1 [[FM broadcasting|FM]], "Power 100.1") is a [[radio station]] broadcasting a [[top 40]] format. Licensed to the suburb of [[Watkinsville, Georgia|Watkinsville]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], it serves the [[Athens, Georgia]] metropolitan area. It first began broadcasting in [[1978 in radio|1978]] under the [[callsign (radio)|call sign]] '''WLOV-FM'''. The station is currently owned by [[Cox Radio]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fcc.gov/fcc-bin/fmq?call=WXKT|title=WXKT Facility Record |work=United States [[Federal Communications Commission]], audio division }} ==History== The station went on the air as WLOV-FM on 1978-12-01, on 1984-10-01 to [[WGPL]], and on 1998-12-01 to WXKT.{{cite web|url=http://licensing.fcc.gov/cgi-bin/ws.exe/prod/cdbs/pubacc/prod/call_hist.pl?Facility_id=51120&Callsign=WXKT |title=WXKT Call Sign History |work=United States [[Federal Communications Commission]], audio division }} On August 14, 1998, [[Cumulus Media]] purchased [[WLOV (AM)|WLOV-AM]] and WLOV-FM from P&T Broadcasting for $533,000.{{cite web|url=http://sec.edgar-online.com/cumulus-media-inc/10-k-annual-report/1999/04/15/section3.aspx|title=Cumulus Media Inc. CMLS Annual Report (10-K)|publisher=[[EDGAR Online]]|date=1998-12-31|accessdate=2010-12-13}} In August 2008, WPUP was sold (along with sister stations [[WGMG]], [[WNGC]], [[WRFC (AM)|WRFC]] and [[WGAU]]) to Cox Radio in Atlanta,"Deals," ''Broadcasting & Cable'', January 28, 2008.{{cite news|url=http://www.allaccess.com/net-news/archive/story/43870/cox-closes-on-athens-cluster|title=Cox Closes On Athens Cluster |work=allaccess.com|date=2008-08-01|accessdate=2010-12-13}} who then swapped call signs moving WXKT calls to 103.7 and changing 100.1 FM to the current call sign '''WPUP'''. The two stations began simulcasting the "Bulldog" classic-rock format; WXKT 100.1 had previously been licensed to [[Washington, Georgia|Washington]] and programmed a "Real [[Country music|Country]]" format. On September 30, 2009, WPUP dopped the "Bulldog" classic rock format and began stunting as "Obama Government Controlled Radio at 100.1 FM."{{cite web|url=http://www.radio-info.com/news/obama-radio-is-the-temporary-stunt-format-at-wpup-fm-athens-ga |title="Obama Radio" is the temporary stunt format at WPUP-FM, Athens, GA |date=October 1, 2009 |work=Radio-Info.com }} The station identifiers claim (jokingly) that the station has been taken over by the government. The station is intermittently simulcasting the Hawaiian music format of sister station KCCN-FM in Honolulu, playing clips from speeches by President Obama, and playing other music President Obama might enjoy, such as the theme song to Shaft. The [[WXKT]] calls remain on 103.7 FM, which changed its city of license to [[Maysville, Georgia]] and now programs a [[talk radio|talk]] format serving the [[Gainesville, Georgia|Gainesville]] market. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{FM station data|WPUP}} {{COX}} {{Contemporary Hit Radio Stations in Georgia}} [[Category:Radio stations in Georgia (U.S. state)|PUP]] [[Category:Classic rock radio stations in the United States]] [[Category:Cox Radio]] {{GeorgiaUS-radio-station-stub}}
